A-Silent-Stable.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

A Silent Stable

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentNeutral
Tier3

Overview

A strange construction, away from town, that seems to primarily be an empty stablehouse. Nobody seems to live here at all, and none are seen coming and going.

Whatever is at work here, though, seems to be growing.

Children from nearby Felsir out playing or doing errands for their family have reported seeing tall, too-slender, almost-alien figures just inside the nearby treeline.

Goals

Relationships

Notes

Abbey-of-Spiders.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Abbey of Spiders

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentNeutral
Tier4

Overview

A religious abbey of spider-women who devote themselves to an up-and-coming spider deity. They have unusual teachings that they wish to spread, and don't care who hears them.

A spider-woman prophet recently emerged as the group's leader. She foretells the near arrival of a once-in-a-millenium spider-man ("Look out! Here comes the Spider Man!").

Goals

Relationships

Notes

Capulet-Clan.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Capulet Clan

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier2

Overview

Some right bastards who aren't to be trusted, even by their friends.
Trying to pull one over on the Montague Clan.

An up and coming trade family currently focused on lumber, but looking to expand their work to supplying the Foolschurch Masons Guild with stone. The Capulet's bright scion Julius is deeply in love with one of the spider-women at the Abbey of Spiders, Shaloth. He has been disguising his trips there as business travel to Salty Swallow and Dorfhalla.

Goals

Relationships

Notes

Carver's-Lake-Frogmen.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Carver's Lake Frogmen

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier0

Overview

A reclusive tribe of Dark aligned slimy Frogmen live on the peninsula at the south of Carver's Lake. After much of their clutch was lost in a storm, the clan has grown small and weak, now preferring to hide from threats than show their prowess with poisoned weapons.

Goals

Goal: rebuild their strength and make some babies

Relationships

Notes

Dorfhalla.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Dorfhalla

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier4

Overview

Goals

Secluded in the mountains is an entrance to a great mine. It is a mine which leads into a series of twisting tunnels that are easy to get lost in, if you don't know your way around underground. Half a mile below the crags is a (Light-aligned) Dwarven stronghold - and a fine example of one. Their warriors are bred for combat, their sorcerers enchant weapons and armor, their forges are always burning hot ready for the smiths, and should it be necessary, every person inside is ready to pick up a weapon in defense of their city.

Dorfhalla is always looking to get purer gold, steel, and other metals for their use... and misuse. While they could be one of the richest localities, their greed for perfection often leads to wasteful use of the materials.

Relationships

Notes

Dryad-Grocers.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Dryad Grocers

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentNeutral
Tier1

Overview

A  grove of dryads forced away from their homes in the East by the Capulet Clan, now trying to show their worth to the local town in order to get ahead of deforestation.

Goals

Bring in a good harvest to pay their taxes for the year to do the same again next year

Relationships

Notes

Farmer's-Collective-Gathering.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Farmer's Collective Gathering

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier1

Overview

A group of Light-aligned farmers has banded together thanks to raids on Felsir, and the no good town guard isn't doing a good job of protecting the town outside of the borders. At the end of every week at sundown, they all gather in one of the farmer's fields to discuss the events of the week, and prepare for the upcoming week.

Goals

They're working to get a new leader/mayor in town who has the best in mind for the farmers, and are otherwise banding together to protect each other's land until that happens.

Relationships

Notes

Felsir.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Felsir

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier3

Overview

Felsir is a large (light-aligned) agricultural center, well protected because of its importance to the region, insulated by the surrounding farms and forest. By the time a threat has reached the city's center the usually lackadaisical town guard has gathered and a militia has already been raised. The Halfling mayor, Andemir Janchate, does his best to play each individual farmstead against the other to maintain a healthy balance of conflict.

Goals

Expand further from the valley they currently occupy, improve their defences. Maintain their agricultural hold on the area.

Relationships

Notes

Foolschurch-Masons-Guild.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Foolschurch Masons Guild

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier1

Overview

The light-aligned guild of Humans and Dwarves that maintain the roads in the region. They expect prompt payment before any pot-holes are filled. Besides road maintenance they are on call on most larger stonework jobs; going with another masonry company would mean angering the union.

Goals

Goal: profit, profit, profit

Relationships

Notes

Grimtol-Keep.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Grimtol Keep

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier4

Overview

An ancient fortress housing a large garrison of the Grimtol Empire's soldiers to maintain control and order in this area.

Goals

Protect the large Light settlements in the area. Destroy or suppress Dark settlements in the area. Destroy the monsters and the dungeon.

Relationships

Notes

Karen-Vann's-Caravans.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Karen Vann's Caravans

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier0

Overview

Karen Vann carries fans via caravan, caring more than the caravan competition. Just ask her caravan fans, the cara-fans. They'll tell you, your goods will arrive "Care of Vann!" (tm). Karen Vann also transports other non-fan goods.

Goals

Goal: Transport goods for money. Expand caravan operations throughout the region.

Relationships

Notes

Merfolk-Manor.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Merfolk Manor

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentNeutral
Tier1

Overview

A few merfolk that have put together a semi-aquatic home to facilitate trade.

Recently, the river feeding the waterfall protecting their home has had reduced flow. The leader of this group of merfolk ("Fin-ley") suspects their mortal enemy the beaver is to blame.

Goals

Make a big haul to take back home to show their home town they made it.

Relationships

Notes

Montague-Clan.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Montague Clan

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier2

Overview

A mean family of craftsman who are cuthroat - in business and literally.

The Montagues are the older, more established of the two clans, both vying for supremacy in supplying lumber and woodcrafts to the region. The patriarch of the Montague clan, Leonato Montague, has been in seclusion for the past three years; no one has seen or heard from him outside the family. Some think he is dying or dead, while others believe he is working on some sort of sinister plot against the Capulet Clan.

Goals

Looking to get a leg up on the Capulet Clan.

Relationships

Notes

Oaken-Vale.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Oaken Vale

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier4

Overview

A (light aligned) conclave of Elven scholars, the Oaken Vale is secluded in the forest, away from the eyes of the common folk. None are welcome unless they come bearing some new invention or discovery, or if they are lucky enough to get a scholarship given by a distinguished member of the Vale. Should an unlucky soul be stupid enough to try to stay around after being rejected, the scholars get an opportunity to test their theorems of magic in a real-life scenario against said unfortunate soul in the Grove of Tears, a naturalistic coliseum where mages are made or broken.

Goals

Acquire knowledge and power, keep the Dark and the riff raff out.

Relationships

Notes

One-Face.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

One Face

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier3

Overview

A singular Facestealer whose adherence to a specific face has given them a taste for the finer things in life. Their comfort in this face allows them to come and go at larger light settlements without much suspicion. This lets them get secret info that other dark factions may not know... and may pay quite the price for.

Goals

Relationships

Notes

Salty-Swallow.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Salty Swallow

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier3

Overview

Salty Swallow is the name given to a ramshackle unincorporated town full of rough former sailors and lake-dwelling types. They don't take kindly to strangers.

Recently, the fishermen of the town have discovered a species of trout in the lake that has aphrodesiac properties when properly prepared. They have just begun exporting their Sensual Swallow for the Salty Sailor.

Goals

Protect the town. Oppose outside influence or incursions into Salty Swallow.

Relationships

Notes

Small-Lizardfolk-Clan.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Small Lizardfolk Clan

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentNeutral
Tier1

Overview

A family of lizardfolk who do not want their land infringed upon.

The lizardfolk's patriarch (Sssseymour) has a weakness for drink, which has recently put his family and their land in jeopardy on several occasions.

Goals

Relationships

Notes

Stubborn-Cultists.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Stubborn Cultists

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier0

Overview

A small group of Dark-aligned creatures stayed behind after their loathsome temple to Gorlag was destroyed. Many moved on to better things, but this group stubbornly believes they can rebuild.

Goals

Rebuild the temple a step at a time, and attract new followers of Gorlag.

Relationships

Notes

The-Butt-Goblins.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Butt Goblins

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier0

Overview

A small offshoot group of goblins wandering in this area, banished by a larger group several regions over for their severe incompetence. The fact that they are still alive is surely due to luck. They are led by the goblin named Butt.

Goals

Survive. Find some sense of security in this region.

Relationships

Notes

The-Cowman.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Cowman

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier2

Overview

A Dark aligned bull slash man hybrid who haunts the forest south of Felsir, the Cowman will slay any unwary travelers who come near his lair; beware his mighty horns and his terrible moo. Also he has a son that he calls Hank.

Goals

Find a mate slash life partner to help him raise his son. Eat The Cowmen.

Relationships

Notes

The-Cowmen.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Cowmen

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier2

Overview

Elven ranchers, led by the cowboy Curly. They are rivals to the Farmers of the nearby town of Felsir.

Goals

Cowmen's goal's: Raise cattle. Oppose the fencing of land by The Farmers.

Curly's goal: court the hobbit Laurey from the nearby town.

Relationships

Notes

aliases:

The Doom of Man

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier4

Overview

A ferocious dragon whose sleepwalking alone is known to take foolish lives.

Goals

Would really like to find a way to sleep better.

Relationships

Notes

The-Farmers.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Farmers

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier1

Overview

Human farmers, led by the farmer Jud. They are rivals to The Cowmen outside town.

Goals

Farmers' goals: Raise crops. Oppose the aggressive grazing of the Cowmen's livestock.

Jud's goal: court the hobbit Laurey in town.

Relationships

Notes

The-Hangman's-Men.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Hangman's Men

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentLight
Tier0
Status💀

Overview

A group of (poor) musicians who have set out for their dream.

Goals

They are trying to decide amongst themselves where to go next.

Relationships

Notes

Killed by the PCs in the very first session. RIP.

The-Red-Knives.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Red Knives

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier3

Overview

A motley, merciless, murderous crew of brigands, who once lived in a temple West of Salty Swallow, until the Swallowers destroyed it. They worship an evil god who demands they spill others' blood and take their possessions.

Goals

Goals: Some are more concerned with satisfying their god's blood demands and kill and steal in order to do so. Others use the blood demands as an excuse to steal and kill. Either way, kill and steal.

The Red Knives are planning to expand (and get vengeance) by attacking and taking over Salty Swallow.

Relationships

Notes

The-Timber-Barge.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Timber Barge

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentNeutral
Tier2

Overview

A group of (neutrally aligned) rather productive and creative gnomes under the company "The Timber Barge Co." have set up shop on the river here, selling passage for travelers needing to cross the river, but more importantly, for hauling wagons and wagons of timber across the river into town.

Goals

They want to keep making money and build up better operations to extort more money from all people wanting to cross here, and also want to keep other options from springing up. That'd be bad for business!

The Timber Barge also wants to keep peace between the Montague Clan and Capulet Clan, who have significant presences on opposite sides of the river crossing. A violent conflict between the two could mean the end of their river crossing business.

Relationships

Notes

The-Troll-Toll.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Troll Toll

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier1

Overview

A group of roadside trolls which occasionally hassle passersby for a toll in order to pass by unscathed. They also enjoy the taste of fresh meat now and again.

The trolls were recently approached by the Foolschurch Masons Guild, who offered to secretly sponsor their toll taking as long as the profits were shared.

Goals

Collect tolls. Avoid too much trouble.

Relationships

Notes

The-Wizard's-Ruse.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

The Wizard's Ruse

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentDark
Tier3

Overview

A (dark-aligned) Wizard named Dula lives underneath this unholy church, using it as a cover for the work she is doing. She hires out (and occasionally gets true) zealots to cause a bit of a disturbance, worship blood gods in the church above, and routinely lets them get cleared out by the local do-gooders. As long as no one finds the secret entrance to her lair, all is well, and no one suspects anything else out of the ordinary would be going on after the cultists are cleared out. And if anyone does find her secret? They better have a good reason to disturb her studies.

Goals

She is working a plot to poison the minds of all the light-aligned towns (and especially gain control over their leaders) and get control of their people and resources.

Relationships

Notes

Wageslave-Automaton.md.content:
metatable: true
tags: [RPG/Faction, RPG/BadManors]
aliases:

Wageslave Automaton

⬅️ Factions

AlignmentNeutral
Tier2

Overview

A golem, their creator long forgotten, who is contractually obligated to continue manning the lighthouse (which serves as a guide or signal for sailors during foggy nights) forever.

Goals

They are interested in contacting a lawyer or barrister to examine and escape their contract.

Relationships

Notes

Light-Tongue.md.content:
Light Tongue

The Light Tongue, spoken by Humans and the like. Monsters usually know a few words from the Light Tongue:

  • you - me - us - it
  • one - two - three - more
  • yes - no - maybe - now
  • go - do - stop - kill
  • eat - give - get - gold

Session-Notes.md.content:
FileTitle
WO-S000 02.03.2022Breaking Bad

WO-S000-02.03.2022.md.content:
metatable: true
title: Breaking Bad
campaign: Bad Manors
session: 000
session_date: 02.03.2022
tags: RPG/BadManors, RPG/SessionNotes/Player
publish: true

Breaking Bad

Next Session ➡
date: 02.03.2022
PCs: Johnathan, Lyra, Gurden, Bilespew
NPC Active:
NPC Discussed:
Location Active:
Location Discussed:

Session Notes

  • We're in the Felsironia, AKA the Sun-Blessed Valley
  • It's a time of peace, boring, sad peace
  • It's also very cold
  • Other players:
    • Gurden, a typical Minotaur. Equipped for combat. A veteran of combat who doesn't need anything fancy. He wants to make some money, exert some power over those who are below him (the Light)
    • Johnathan, a very tall, very wide Troll. Often dragging his knuckles. Very into smashing (stabbing is just more precise smashing). Easily distracted by nature. Enjoys violence for his own sake. A bit of a collector.
      • Johnathan may or may not be afraid of fire.
    • Lyra, a Siren who thinks she is more beautiful than any other (or so she thinks). Waist up, a human looking woman, usually bare breasted ("hubba hubba" - Jordan). She has wings that let her swim and fly, and a tail good for swimming. Very shimmering. Has a cruel sense of humor, thinks its fun to make people uncomfortable and/or tricking people into their deaths on sharp, jagged rocks. In it for the party.
  • Our Dungeon:
    • What does the exterior look like?
      • Some kind of bloodied arch, as long as its near a sea
    • What sort of lighting do we want in our dungeon:
      • Cool lanterns
      • Probably not fire
    • What sort of stuff do we keep:
      • A conflict! Lyra wants a big pile of bodies. Bilespew wants arcane implements.
      • Opposed rolls are between players.
    • "Johnathan hasn't smashed since breakfast!"
  • A group of beings speaking the Light tongue!
    • We smash one.
    • There are more in a cave, 3 of them
      • I try and sneak in, but fall on my face, alerting them
      • I make one of them spray blood from their eyes, all over them and me
        • It's delicious
        • The humie faints
    • Johnathan tries to scare them
    • Gurden smashes one of them with a burning implement, accidentally killing them
    • I go smash the other with my blood covered staff
      • He tries to kick me but I dodge and weave, and get my shot in, kneecapping him
      • he's in a bad way
  • The cave might be the perfect place for a dungeon 👀
    • We hear a small noise from the opening of the cave
    • A small automaton/golem!
    • They start cleaning up!
  • We start montage through building a dungeon

Post session notes
